analysis.heading: Height & grade
analysis.content: Height allowances enable a variety of architectural styles while preserving the residential scale of our neighborhoods as well as the privacy and natural light available to each lot.
figures: Fig 42 Comparison of roof slopes - Shows different roof slopes from 12:14 to 12:3 with height limits of 33' and 30'
Fig 43 Determining slope of roof - Diagram showing 12' horizontal measurement and vertical rise
tables:
Structure height table showing maximum heights:
Main dwelling on standard lot with roof slope >12:12: 30'
Main dwelling on standard lot with roof slope ≥12:12: 33'
Main dwelling on substandard or flag lot: 17'
Accessory structure in rear or side yard: 12'
2nd-dwelling units: 17'
